010package imagingbook.pub.color.image;
011
012import static imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix.multiply;
013
014/**
015 * This class represents a linear chromatic adaptation transform.
016 * The transformation is specified by the matrix 'Mfwd' and its
017 * inverse 'Minv'.
018 */
019public class BradfordAdaptation implements ChromaticAdaptation {
020        // TODO: convert all matrices to float? or all vectors to double?
021        
022        // CAT transform matrices (forward and inverse)
023        private static double[][] Mfwd = {
024            { 0.8951,  0.2664, -0.1614},
025            {-0.7502,  1.7135,  0.0367},
026            { 0.0389, -0.0685,  1.0296}};
027            
028        private static double[][] Minv = {      
029                { 0.9869929055, -0.1470542564, 0.1599626517}, 
030                { 0.4323052697,  0.5183602715, 0.0492912282},
031                {-0.0085286646,  0.0400428217, 0.9684866958}};
032        
033        //      the complete color adaptation transformation matrix
034        private final double[][] Mcat;
035        
036        
037        public BradfordAdaptation(double[] W1, double[] W2) {
038                double[] rgb1 = multiply(Mfwd, W1);
039                double[] rgb2 = multiply(Mfwd, W2);
040                double[][] Mrgb = rgbMatrix(rgb1, rgb2);
041                Mcat = multiply(Minv, multiply(Mrgb, Mfwd));
042        }
043        
044        public BradfordAdaptation(Illuminant illum1, Illuminant illum2) {
045                this(illum1.getXYZ(), illum2.getXYZ());
046        }
047        
048        // transformation of color coordinates
049        @Override
050        public float[] applyTo(float[] XYZ1) {
051                // TODO: replace by matrix/vector product!
052                float[] XYZ2 = new float[3];
053                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
054                        XYZ2[i] = (float) (Mcat[i][0] * XYZ1[0] + Mcat[i][1] * XYZ1[1] + Mcat[i][2] * XYZ1[2]);
055                }
056                return XYZ2;
057        }
058        
059        public double[][] getMcat() {
060                return this.Mcat;
061        }
062        
063
064        // returns a diagonal matrix with the ratios of the rgb components
065        // obtained by transforming the two white points
066        // TODO: no deed to create a matrix!!
067        private double[][] rgbMatrix(double[] rgb1, double[] rgb2) {
068                if (rgb1.length != rgb2.length)
069                        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
070                int n = rgb1.length;
071                double[][] Madapt = new double[n][n];
072                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
073                        Madapt[i][i] = rgb2[i] / rgb1[i];
074                }
075                return Madapt;
076        }
077        
078        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
079        
080//      public static void main(String[] args) {
081//              
082//              BradfordAdaptation adapt = new BradfordAdaptation(D65, D50);    // adapts from D65 -> D50
083//              
084//              System.out.println("Mcat = \n" + Matrix.toString(adapt.getMcat()));
085//              System.out.println();
086//              
087//              
088//              PrintPrecision.set(4);
089//              ColorSpace cs = new sRgb65ColorSpace();
090//              float[] red = {1, 0, 0};
091//              float[] grn = {0, 1, 0};
092//              float[] blu = {0, 0, 1};
093//              
094//              float[] rgb1 = blu;
095//              
096//              System.out.println("rgb1 = " + Matrix.toString(rgb1));
097//              float[] XYZ65 = cs.toCIEXYZ(rgb1);
098//              System.out.println("XYZ65 = " + Matrix.toString(XYZ65));
099//              
100//              float[] xy65 = CieUtil.xyzToxy(XYZ65);
101//              System.out.println("xy65 = " + Matrix.toString(xy65));
102//              
103//              float[] XYZ50 = adapt.apply(XYZ65);
104//              System.out.println("XYZ50 = " + Matrix.toString(XYZ50));
105//              
106//              float[] xy50 = CieUtil.xyzToxy(XYZ50);
107//              System.out.println("xy50 = " + Matrix.toString(xy50));
108//              
109//              float[] rgb2 = cs.fromCIEXYZ(XYZ65);
110//              System.out.println("rgb2 = " + Matrix.toString(rgb2));
111//              
112//      }
113        
114        
115}
